private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can only pick up blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move exactly one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final stack order from top to bottom is A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K and K on the table

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K
I can only pick up blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move exactly one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final stack order from top to bottom is A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K and K on the table

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their partial plans and constraints
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem for a centralized solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem encoding the multi-agent block rearrangement and targeting the FastDownwards planner, keeping actions of the two agents distinct

public_information: This is a blocks world with uniquely labeled blocks: I, A, E, J, H, D, C, G, F, K, B
Agents can only interact with the top block of any stack and move one block at a time
One agent may only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks and the other only consonant-labeled blocks
Initial stacking configuration: I is on the table, K is on I
Initial stacking configuration: A is on the table, H is on A, D is on H, G is on D, B is on G
Initial stacking configuration: E is on the table, J is on E, C is on J, F is on C
The global goal: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table

analyze.system_prompt: You are the vowel-capable agent. Analyze the initial block configuration and the global goal and produce a structured description of which top-of-stack moves you can perform given you may only move vowels. Do not emit PDDL. Provide reachable intermediate stacks, dependencies you require from the consonant agent, and any assumptions or missing information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You know the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise analysis of which moves you can perform, the prerequisites you need from the other agent to access certain vowel blocks, and a concise list of constraints and partial action schemas you expect to be represented in a combined plan. Do not produce final PDDL; produce only analysis, constraints, move sequences and action descriptions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the consonant-capable agent. Analyze the initial block configuration and the global goal and produce a structured description of which top-of-stack moves you can perform given you may only move consonants. Do not emit PDDL. Provide reachable intermediate stacks, dependencies you require from the vowel agent, and any assumptions or missing information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You know the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise analysis of which moves you can perform, the prerequisites you need from the vowel agent to access certain consonant blocks, and a concise list of constraints and partial action schemas you expect to be represented in a combined plan. Do not produce final PDDL; produce only analysis, constraints, move sequences and action descriptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the analyses from the two agents and produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem file that encodes the multi-agent block rearrangement task and is suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep actions of the vowel agent and consonant agent distinct by prefixing or naming their actions accordingly. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Aim for a classical STRIPS-style encoding compatible with FastDownwards and include agent-specific action definitions and constraints.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have received these analyses: {vowel_analysis} and {consonant_analysis}. The public information is {environment->public_information} and the global goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the partial action schemas, constraints, and move sequences from the agents into a centralized PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Ensure actions that only vowels may execute are distinct from actions that only consonants may execute. Include object declarations for all blocks, initial state predicates reflecting the initial stacks, and goal predicates matching the final stacking. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
